org.jetel.util.exec

Class LoggerDataConsumer

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jetel.util.exec.LoggerDataConsumer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    DataConsumer

    public class LoggerDataConsumer
extends java.lang.Object
implements DataConsumer
    Reads data from input stream, which is supposed to be connected to process' output or more usually to error output, and writes the data using logger.
    Since:
    10/11/06
    See Also:
    ProcBox, DataConsumer

    • Constructor Detail

      • LoggerDataConsumer

        public LoggerDataConsumer(int level,
                  int maxLines)
        Sole ctor.
        Parameters:
        level - Log level.
        maxLines - Max count of lines written to log. 0 for all. Excessive lines will be discarded.

      • setInput

        public void setInput(java.io.InputStream stream)
        Description copied from interface: DataConsumer
        Set stream supplying data to be consumed. It is supposed to be called exactly once and before any call to other interface's methods.

        public boolean consume()
                throws JetelException
        Description copied from interface: DataConsumer
        Consumes one piece of data.
        Specified by:
        consume in interface DataConsumer
        Returns:
        false when no more data are available, true otherwise.

        JetelException

      • close

        public void close()
        Description copied from interface: DataConsumer
        This is supposed to release resources used by other methods. It should not close input stream!
        Specified by:
